t: The Lord Is My Strength and My Shield
To*pn you, O Lord,*s I call; my*ld rock, be not deaf to me, lest,*ln if you be silent to me, I*ld become like those who go down to the pit.
Hear*ln the voice of my pleas for mercy, when*ld I cry to you for help, when*ln I lift up my hands toward*ld your most holy sanctuary.
Do*pn not drag me off with the wicked, with*ld the workers of evil, who*ln speak peace with their neighbors while*ld evil is in their hearts.
Give*ln to them according to their work and*ld according to the evil of their deeds; give*ln to them according to the work of their hands; render*ld them their due reward.
Because*ln they do not regard the works of the Lord*s or*ld the work of his hands, he*ln will tear them down and build them up no more.
Blessed*pn be the Lord!*s For*ld he has heard the voice of my pleas for mercy.
The*ln Lord*s is my strength and my shield; in*ld him my heart trusts, and I am helped; my*ln heart exults, and*ld with my song I give thanks to him.
The*pn Lord*s is the strength of his people; he*ld is the saving refuge of his anointed.
Oh,*ln save your people and bless your heritage! Be*ld their shepherd and carry them forever.
